mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Walter Gibson Peter to "dear sister", 1862 October 13
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Peter, Walter Gibson, 1842-1863
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Walter Gibson Peter writes from Lynchburg Virginia to his "dear sister." A continuation from a previous letter - see letter dated 1862 October 12. Recounts time served in Civil War. Recovered in Columbus, Mississippi from typhoid fever, left with Orton Williams on 1st of July to Aberdeen, Mississippi. While en route, encounters Confederate army and leaves wagon and belongings behind to join forces on their way to meet General Bragg in Mobile, Alabama. Falls ill again, takes sick furlough to Lynchburg where he has remained for two months. Never recovered lost trunk of belongings. Has to replenish wardrobe...'exposure and exercise in the Army will kill me or cure me.' Suffering from internal pain and headaches. Leaving letters with Cousin Walter. Continues serving the Army for his sister but never expects to return to Maryland again. Signed 'W. G. Peter, 2nd Lieutenant, C.S.A.' Autograph letter signed, 3 pages.
